intro: Dodecatheon cylindrocarpum, commonly known as the cylindrical-fruited globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its fruit is a cylindrical capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature that aids in its dispersal. Dodecatheon cylindrocarpum is often found in alpine and woodland habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
